bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition of swelling and pain in the gullet resulting from an inadvertent ingestion of awns or spikes of cereals. Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 35: 禾裹有短穗而強澀者是也。誤作米 而食之，則令喉裏腫結不通，致風熱氣衝於喉間，與血氣相搏，則生腫 結，如食飲，疼痛妨悶，故謂之穀賊 , “When standing grain is bound, this includes those short spikes that are stiff and rough. If in the preparation of rice they are mistakenly included they cause swelling and nodes in the gullet, blocking passages through it. This leads to a rush of wind and heat qi into the gullet which clashes with blood and qi there. This generates swelling and nodes. Drinking and eating causes pain. [The gullet] is sealed and [patients experience] heart-pressure. Hence one calls this ‘ grain intrusion ’”.
